sentences.english: He pilled with grievous taxes and quite lost their hearts.
sentences.chinese: 他用苛捐雜稅剝奪百姓，失盡民心。

sentences.english: The exaction was revived by Richard I.
sentences.chinese: 這種苛捐雜稅被查理一世加以恢復。

sentences.english: If they did not pay those cruel taxes, they were thrown into prison.
sentences.chinese: 如果人們付不出這些苛捐雜稅，就會被投入監獄。

sentences.english: The citizens complained to heaven about the tax burden.
sentences.chinese: 公民對苛捐雜稅怨聲載道。

sentences.english: Ever higher dues ruined trade and depopulated towns.
sentences.chinese: 越來越高的苛捐雜稅使商業凋敝，城鎮人口減少。
